item.comment: My favourite light game played with a traditional deck of cards.

item.name: 6 nimmt!
item.comment: A quick, fun little game where you try to guess the actions of other players. At first seems very random but in the end you discover that the same people are winning all the time. Plays great with 3 to 6 players, with more the chaos is too big.

item.name: 7 Wonders
item.comment:
Base game: A good game but with no meat in it. Most of the decisions in the second half of the game are obvious. I prefer to play this with fewer people to have whatever control on what cards will come back to me. But again, with fewer players I rather play Dominion than this.
With expansions: they do add the meat :) Especially Leaders are a must have if you own 7 Wonders - they force you to play each game differently.

item.name: 7 Wonders: Leaders
item.comment: A must have for every 7 Wonders owner.

item.name: Aber Bitte mit Sahne: Das Joker-Stück
Admiral Ackbar "It's a TRAP!" GAME
item.comment: No decisions = not a game

item.name: Age of Conan: The Strategy Board Game
Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
Age of Steam Expansion #2: Western US and Germany
Age of Steam Expansion #3: Scandinavia and Korea
Age of Steam Expansion #4: France and Italy
Age of Steam Expansion: America / Europe
Age of Steam Expansion: Chile, Egypt and CCCP
Age of Steam Expansion: China / South America
Age of Steam Expansion: Disco Inferno / Soul Train
Age of Steam Expansion: Holland / Madagascar
Age of Steam Expansion: Mexico, Spain/Portugal
Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small
Alien Frontiers: The Mind Control Helmet
Android: Netrunner – A Study in Static
Animal Upon Animal
item.comment: It's amazing that this works so well. When you see all the animals in weird shapes you think that there is no way that you can put one on another without making other pieces fall but it really works well.

item.name: Antike
item.comment: This is fun, but the scores are always too close ("I would win on my next turn!", "But, I would won before you!") for my liking.

item.name: Arkadia
item.comment: This is a two player game. Only.

item.name: Aronda
item.comment: This is an interesting idea for an area control two player abstract strategy. One of my favourite abstracts.

item.name: Article 27: The UN Security Council Game
Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Deep Drone Promo
Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Pathwarden Promo
Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Vedah, Sage of Swords Promo
Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Void Mesmer Promo
Assyria
item.comment:
After one two player game it seems to be a fine and well working euro. There are definitely lots of ways to score points here and it needs several plays to discover what strategies will turn out to be the most effective.
+ really solid and balanced game + lots of strategic options - feels like many other games, doesn't have something that would make it more unique - the borders on the board for two and three players are not really clear - if you are last in turn order you can nothing about it if others will choose so. If you are first you can be first for the whole game if you choose

item.name: Asteroyds
item.comment: Played only the first scenario. At first it is hard to plan your move without hitting everything around and it takes couple of turns to learn it. I hope the next scenarios are more complex as the first one after 2 plays is longer a challenge.

item.name: Axis & Allies: Battle of the Bulge
BANG!
item.comment: I regret buying this as some of my friends refuse to play anything else now. Fun but after 2 plays in a row I really don't want to start another one. It also has the problem of the possible elimination before making even one turn.

item.name: Battle of the Bands
item.comment: Nice theme but the game itself is bad. 95% of your turns you have no reasons to choose one card over another as they either will bring you the same result or it will depend on what cards has your opponent. The other 5% is absolutely obvious.

item.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill
BGO Extended 2.0 expansion (fan expansion for Through the Ages)
Bingo
item.comment: Pure luck, no decisions.

item.name: Black Stories
item.comment:
Fun, but not a game.
7/10 for an activity.

item.name: Black Stories 5
item.comment:
Not a game.
3/10 for an activity. The stories are much worse than in the first part.

item.name: Black Stories: Sex and Crime Edition
item.comment:
Not a game.
5/10 for an activity.

item.name: Blood Bowl: Team Manager – The Card Game
Bohnanza
item.comment: I love games with lots of negotiations and this is such a game. There are moments when it feels too random but usually the player who was able to negotiate the best deal should win.

item.name: Bosworth
item.comment: Nice idea for multi-player chess. At the beginning it is quite chaotic as in many other not two player abstract strategies, but there is some space for deep thinking.

item.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game
Callisto: The Game
item.comment: Better than Blokus. More aggressive more interaction more things to think about.

item.name: Carrom
item.comment:
This is a sport. This is nothing like Crokinole - it's much harder to start playing well and you can play for many years and still learn the game. The better player will usually win. If you don't want to spend many hours playing this I would not recommend buying the game.
+ a game you might want to play all your life and get better and better at it + you see your skill growing + depending on your time and mood you can play a full game or only one break + good with 2 and 4 players. Also fun to practice by yourself

item.name: Cash-a-Catch
item.comment: Games were you have to be first to hit something and probably be better arguing that it was you who was first not your opponent are definitely not for me.

item.name: The Castles of Burgundy: 2nd Expansion – New Hex Tiles
The Castles of Burgundy: 4th Expansion – Monastery Boards
Catan Histories: Settlers of America – Trails to Rails
Catan: Seafarers
item.comment: I don't understand why this was released. It adds absolutely nothing new to the game. So we can build a new kind of road? Hooray.

item.name: Caterpillar Dice
item.comment: Absolutely no decisions in this game.

item.name: Caylus
item.comment: The best euro ever.

item.name: Chaos in the Old World: The Horned Rat Expansion
Chupacabra: Survive the Night
item.comment: Awful. Totally luck based, the decisions are so obvious that almost non-existent, a huge runaway leader aspect. And long. Or at least it felt like it took for ages to end a game after it was clear who the winner will be.

item.name: Co-Mix
item.comment: I'm not a Once Upon a Time person.

item.name: Conflict of Heroes: Storms of Steel! – Kursk 1943
Confusion: Espionage and Deception in the Cold War
Core Worlds: Galactic Orders Promo Pack
Cosmic Encounter
item.comment: Don't play this to win. It's great fun with the right group of people in the right mood but you control almost nothing here.

item.name: Cosmic Wimpout
item.comment: Bleh. This could have been an idea for a push your luck game but it went totally wrong. You are too often forced to re-roll which causes that you stop almost whenever you have a chance. Not fun at all.

item.name: The Curse of the Black Dice
Cyclades
item.comment: 4 years ago I would love this but apparently euro games have sucked all "the bash the leader fun" out of me ;)

item.name: Czarne historie 2
item.comment:
Not a game.
6/10 for an activity

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
Defenders of the Realm
item.comment:
If it had not Pandemic all over it I would probably give this a bit better rating. But as it is I can never see me choosing to play the more random, chaotic, longer with bigger downtime version of Pandemic rather than Pandemic itself.
A co-op game should crush the players the first (first few) time they play it. This one doesn't and because of that leaves no desire to return to it, learn the strategies, get some revenge etc.

item.name: Defenders of the Realm: The Barbarian
item.comment: If I liked the game I would be happy to have this mini expansion ;)

item.name: Discworld: Ankh-Morpork
item.comment:
With 4 people I think that this is unplayable. It is so easy to stop people from achieving their goals that there is no way that you will be able to achieve your win condition in your turn and none of the three other players will do nothing about it. Our all four player games were won by the guy who won when nobody achieves his win condition before the deck ends. Perhaps the role that wants to earn a certain amount of money has some chance but if after dealing the roles you know in more than half the games that you have no chance of winning then why bother playing this?
Stay away from this.

item.name: Dixit
item.comment:
Now this is really a game in which you shouldn't care if you win or lose. This is all about fun and some interesting brain exercises.
It's very important to keep the game fair and not describing a card in a way you know that only one person by the table will guess.
After 6-7 games I was full and it became harder and harder to make descriptions you didn't make before. I need Dixit 2 to still have fun playing this.

item.name: Dobble: Kostenlose Demoversion
item.comment: This really should not have it's own entry.

item.name: Dominant Species
item.comment: Very fun to play, lot's of things going on, definitely a try for El Grande fans.

item.name: Dominion: Intrigue
item.comment: My favourite Dominion part so far. It was incredible to play this after playing over 70 games of the base game - it really brought up the idea to a whole new level. I love the fact that there are much more choices in the game. You not only choose what to buy but you also have several options to play an action card. I love the victory/action or victory/treasure cards. I love the fact that the rule from the base game (who first buys gold wins) is much more rare with the expansion. I love cards like Courtyard which allow you to decide if you want your current turn to be as good as possible or do you want to make your chances bigger to have a great next turn.

item.name: Dominion: Prosperity
item.comment: Definitely my favourite Dominion expansion so far. The action cards perhaps are not the most exciting so far but the Colonies and Platinum really adds the game a new feel.

item.name: Dominion: Seaside
item.comment:
Was a 10 but the tresaure map is just too bad.
Not as good as Intrigue but still better than the base game. I like the new Duration cards (they're orange!:)) - they do bring a new concept to the game as you often have to decide if you want to try to get a good turn now or increase your chances for a good next turn.
I hate the Treasure Map. I wouldn't call it broken in every situation but it is in my opinion too much random. If you have enough luck to draw two of them early then you are a sure winner (or at least you compete with other players who were able to do it). Also, I hate cards that if they show up they force you to buy them if you want to win the game. Treasure Map when there is also a Tactician/Smithy/Council Room is one of them.

item.name: Drako
item.comment: Nice and quick 2 player game with different strategies for both sides.

item.name: Duel in the Dark: 3-5 Player Variant
Duel in the Dark: Acoustic Mirror
Duel in the Dark: British 3.7in QF Anti-Aircraft Gun
Duel in the Dark: British Searchlight
Duel in the Dark: Ju88 Night Fighter
Duel in the Dark: Quad Flak
Duel in the Dark: Railroad Flak
Duel in the Dark: Skilled Gun Crew
Duel in the Dark: The Complete Edition – Expansion
Duel in the Dark: The Walls Have Ears
Dungeoneer: Dragons of the Forsaken Desert
Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: Temple of Elemental Evil Board Game
Eat Poop You Cat
item.comment:
This is not a game in the BGG meaning of the word. But it is a lot of fun with the right group of people.
7/10 for an activity
+ you can play it everywhere + everyone is laughing from the very beginning of the game + a way to learn what is in the heads of your friends - this should be in the Outside the Scope of BGG

item.name: Elfenland
item.comment: It would be much more fun without the "beat the leader" part. As it is I prefer good old Settlers.

item.name: En Garde
item.comment: Great, quick, light two player game in which you really feel like being in a duel.

item.name: Era Of Inventions: The Golden Goal
Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Fauna
item.comment:
Another really fun betting game. It has a bit of a Wits and Wagers feel in it but it is much more skill based.
Rating went down after a couple of animals which had "Brazilian" or something like that and lived in one region giving the starting player a big advantage.
I win 75% of the time although usually there is at least one person playing who knows much more about animals than me. I am starting to have a feeling that the game is more about the skill of deciding were to bet first than actual knowledge.

item.name: Felix: The Cat in the Sack
Fields of Arle
item.comment: Probably will go up after a second play.

item.name: Fliegen klatschen
item.comment: A silly real time game. Nothing special but not bad for what it is. I suggest playing always the variant in which you can use both hands to kill flies even when many people are playing.

item.name: Funny Friends
item.comment: Great game in which you definitely need to have both genders playing. Great cards with great and funny illustrations. Another game which you should play to have fun not to win as you control almost nothing.

item.name: Futbol Ligretto
item.comment:
The best quick real time game. Requires much more skill than it first seems. Definitely better to play in 2 or 3 player teams.
+ quick + fun to discover that it's not as random as it looks + plays good with any number of players +/- when you play in teams it will be loud

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment: Fun, but I understand the concern that often only the first player to end the spaceship is really playing as all the adventures happen to him.

item.name: Gambit 7
item.comment: Better questions than in Wits and Wagers but the scoring is much worse.

item.name: The Game of Life: Card Game
A Game of Thrones (first edition)
item.comment: This is NOT Diplomacy light. It is a great tense game because you can build strong armies here, you do not feel the feeling that you MUST co-operate to have a chance.

item.name: A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition)
A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
item.comment: It seems that spending huge amounts of money is not the only reason why I dislike CCGs. Too much key words for my liking. Also there are cards that look as they were good only when you buy some expansions.

item.name: The Game: Spiel...so lange du kannst!
Gang of Four
item.comment: Don't even dare comparing this with Tichu!

item.name: Gauntlet of Fools
item.comment: It seems that for this game to be fun you have to be lucky to draw heroes that are not too similar. I will probably try next time to play with 2 heroes for each player.

item.name: Gloom
item.comment: Great and funny theme, great idea for the see-through cards but apart of that the game is not in any way special.

item.name: Go
item.comment: Definitely the best game ever. A game which you can never learn to play perfectly. Frankly, I do not treat Go like a board game, but more as a sport. Just like other sports it only has sense if you want to spend lots of time improving your skills.

item.name: Grzybobranie
item.comment: No decisions, pure luck.

item.name: Habitat
item.comment: A very pretty game with an interesting idea. The mechanics are too nasty and chaotic for my taste but I still like to play just for the fun of looking at the animals :)

item.name: Helvetia
item.comment: 8 for a 3 player game, 6 for a 4 player game.

item.name: Hero: Immortal King – The Den of Dementia
Hero: Immortal King – The Lair of the Lich
Hooyah: Navy Seals Card Game
item.comment: A co-op to play with your non-gaming friends. A completely pasted on theme.

item.name: I Don't Know, What Do You Want To Play?
item.comment: Played with SamLL veto token's variant http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/371583/why-is-this-not-everyone-pick-your-favorite-and-ta

item.name: Imperial Settlers: Why Can't We Be Friends
In the Shadow of the Emperor
In the Year of the Dragon
Journey to the Center of the Earth
Jungle Treasure
item.comment: A quick, fun party game. I love the feeling during my turn that the time MUST end in a couple oconds and the shaking hands while building/searching for something.

item.name: Kapitan Bomba
item.comment: First of all it seems completely unbalanced. Second of all it is extremely vulgar in a not funny but pathetic way.

item.name: Khet: The Laser Game
item.comment: This is just cool. It reminds playing chess but the laser changing it's directions due to mirrors is the most awesome thing I have ever seen in board games :)

item.name: King of New York: Improvised Weapons
King of Tokyo: Garfield's Gift Promo Card
Knock! Knock!
item.comment: Stupid and not fun. Kakerlaken Poker done wrong.

item.name: Kolejka
item.comment: Chaos, chaos and nothing but chaos. No control at all.

item.name: L-Game
item.comment: Will this ever end? I am not convinced that it is possible to win this game against a semi-smart player.

item.name: Last Night on Earth: Growing Hunger
Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
LCR
item.comment: Pure luck, no decisions.

item.name: Legendary Encounters: An Alien Deck Building Game
Leszczynowa Zgraja
item.comment: Games for kids should bring fun to adults also. Like Gulo Gulo. This is not fun at all.

item.name: Level Up
item.comment: If you like Rummy - just play Rummy. If you don't like Rummy stay as far as possible from this game.

item.name: Liar's Dice
item.comment: The best bluffing game ever.

item.name: Liberator: Warszawa 1944
item.comment: Great expansion. Adds some possibilities but doesn't force you to use them.

item.name: The Little Game of Good Manners
The Little Prince: Make Me a Planet
Log Jam
item.comment: A Jenga type game but unfortunately usually someone loses after 3 or 4 turns.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: Friends & Foes
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
item.comment:
Loving Lord of the Rings, co-op games and card games I knew it was a game for me :)
I'm a bit disappointed with the limited options of deck-building in the core set - playing with two players forces you to build dual sphere decks so you have to build a 50 card deck from a pool of 60 cards. Sounds like fun?
It took me 50 games to feel a bit tired of the game but I am sure that each adventure pack will bring a bit of freshness to the game.

item.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – A Journey to Rhosgobel
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Conflict at the Carrock
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Foundations of Stone
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Heirs of Númenor
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Khazad-dûm
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Return to Mirkwood
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Road to Rivendell
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Shadow and Flame
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Dead Marshes
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Hills of Emyn Muil
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Hobbit: Over Hill and Under Hill
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Hunt for Gollum
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Long Dark
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Massing at Osgiliath
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Redhorn Gate
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Redhorn Gate
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Watcher in the Water
Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation (Deluxe Edition)
Lord of the Rings: The Duel
The Lord of the Rings: The Mines of Moria
Love Letter
item.comment: So, so. Very quick but also extremely random.

item.name: Lucky Sock Dip: The Card Game
Maharaja: The Game of Palace Building in India
Mali Powstańcy: Warszawa 1944
item.comment: A good solid game. I like that you can plan a lot of things and you always know if you will be the first to deliver an order or not. There is never a turn when you have absolutely nothing to do. Advance rules only.

item.name: Mansions of Madness: Call of the Wild
Mansions of Madness: Season of the Witch
Mansions of Madness: The Silver Tablet
Martian Chess
item.comment: Rating for what I think a 2 player game would be not for the 3 player game I played.

item.name: Medici vs Strozzi
item.comment: A great two player game with little luck factor. I was surprised that you can make such a good auction game for only two players.

item.name: Middle-Earth Quest
item.comment:
I don't like adventure games but this is probably the best one I played. I like the mechanic with the cards you use being at the same time your life - every card you play means one less life point. I love the way the fights take place, it is much more interesting than any other battle mechanic I know.
Still, I'm not sure if the quests are balanced - some seem very easy (have a number of Scrolls at the end of the game), some seem much harder (only two monster tokens on the board at the end of the game). But I didn't play enough to make strong opinions on this.
I would be happy to play it more often if it didn't take so much time. You should count at least 1 hour for each player, probably a bit more.

item.name: Moral Dilemma
item.comment:
Not a game.
As an activity it would get maybe a 2.

item.name: Mord im Arosa
item.comment: I prefer Igloo Pop. The 5 player game I played was definitely too long and we stopped playing before the game ended. I was told that a 3, 4 player games end much quicker and if that's true the game would have a 6. But I don't think that I will ever want to check it.

item.name: Myrmes
item.comment: This game has HUGE A/P potential, you basically have to plan your whole turn at the beginning of it and you really have a lot of options what to do. In our game the planning phase took sometimes over 15 minutes. I cannot see this ending in 75 minutes.

item.name: Na Grunwald: rycerze króla Jagiełły
item.comment:
Fun, semi-light, quick.
After more plays and watching other people play I'm a bit concerned that the first and mostly second player at the start of the game have some advantage. In the first 2-3 turns it seems to be better to be the starting player (it's easier to get more workers) and in the next ones it's better to be last. So the first and second player at the start of the game begin the turn when it is good to begin it and end it when it is good to end them.

item.name: Neuroshima Hex! Doomsday Machine 1.0
item.comment: + It is exactly how a small expansion like this should look like - the army could easily be in the base game, after two games it does not seem to be too or too little powerful.

item.name: The New Era: Spiel 2011 Promo Pack
Old Town: Solitär
item.comment:
In no way this can count as a game, it's a pure logic puzzle. A nice one.
7/10 for a puzzle.

item.name: Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game
Outside the Scope of BGG
item.comment: OtSoBGG = pool, darts, bowling etc.

item.name: Pandemic: On the Brink
item.comment:
I got bored with Pandemic after playing about 30 times the base game. This expansion did exactly what it should have done - it brings variety to the game but still keeps the core mechanics the same.
+ you still feel that you are playing Pandemic + lots of new roles, special actions + new ideas for the diseases

item.name: The Pillars of the Earth
item.comment: I would like this game if not for the stupid and random selecting who places their worker mechanic which causes that it is hard to plan anything during the game.

item.name: The Pillars of the Earth: Builders Duel
Poker Dice
item.comment: Worse, more random, much more obvious than yahtzee

item.name: Police Precinct
item.comment: First two games seemed way too easy. Might go up.

item.name: Power Grid: Northern Europe/United Kingdom & Ireland
Power Grid: The New Power Plant Cards
Prêt-à-Porter
item.comment: A few minor changes to the graphic side of the game and I would love it. Unfortunately I hate being forced to read lots of text during the game and it makes it a lot harder to keep track of what everybody is doing around you. Really, there is a reason why in most of the games you have lots of easy to interprate icons not tons of text. It's not a big thing but personally for me it made it impossible to enjoy the game. Otherwise the mechanics seem to be really good.

item.name: Puerto Rico: Expansion I – New Buildings
Pyramidion
item.comment: Making it possible for the first player to always pick to be first in the next round is just bad game design.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
Race for the Galaxy: The Brink of War
Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
Railways of the World: The Card Game
Reguły Gry
item.comment: The memory aspect of the game doesn't work - I cannot believe that someone might forget what ~4 cards he has laid in front of him during the last minute. Unfortunately there is nothing more here.

item.name: Reiner Knizia's Decathlon
item.comment: + a few disciplines have a nice idea - abstract, you don't feel the theme - some disciplines are completely random

item.name: Ribbit
item.comment: A 5 minute game that I am always willing to play. It's great for children and also adults should not complain while playing this. The game is really random and is mostly about who gets the card that moves his turtle two spaces ahead. But the turtles are cute and the game always causes a lot of laughter (although I don't know why :))

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
Rock the Beat
item.comment: Like to play it but hate to be in the same room in which someone else is playing it :)

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
Roll Through the Ages: The Late Bronze Age
Rory's Story Cubes
item.comment: Not a game but may be a fun activity for people who like Dixit or Once Upon a Time.

item.name: Runebound: The Terrors of the Tomb
Shadows over Camelot: Sir Bedivere, the 8th Knight
Shadows over Camelot: The Card Game
Show Business
item.comment:
Prototype play.
I felt that I have too little control for such a long game. There is often no time to react to the other players actions.

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Small World: Grand Dames of Small World
Smash Up
item.comment:
Has a very CCG feel. A fun game with lots of small combos, which force you to think how to play your cards. I'm not sure if it's great for two players - the difference between scoring first and scoring second is not that big.
I want cowboys in the expansion!

item.name: Solitaire
item.comment: Not a game. 5 for a puzzle.

item.name: Space Hulk (third edition)
item.comment: This shouldnt even be as a seperate game.

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game
Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game – Mission Pack 1
Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game: Space Marine Pack 1
Spartacus: A Game of Blood & Treachery
Star Trek: Fleet Captains
item.comment: One for player game. I will probably refuse to play it with more than 2 players but I can't wait trying it out with just one opponent.

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – A-Wing Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Millennium Falcon Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Slave I Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Advanced Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Fighter Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Interceptor Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – X-Wing Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Y-Wing Expansion Pack
Stronghold
item.comment:
I had high expectations for this one and I was not disappointed. A great, deep game in which every turn has a lot of tense. The game is well balanced if both players play good but it is much more forgiving for the invader. The defender must be more concentrated as one little mistake may easily end the game immediately.
So far I think that the 4 player option is the best one. The dividing of the board sides between team players works out nice and natural.

item.name: Summoner Wars: Fallen Kingdom Faction Deck
Summoner Wars: Goodwin's Blade Reinforcement Pack
Summoner Wars: Guild Dwarves vs Cave Goblins
Summoner Wars: Jungle Elves Faction Deck
Summoner Wars: Phoenix Elves vs Tundra Orcs
Summoner Wars: Rukar's Power Reinforcements Pack
Terra Mystica: Bonus Card Shipping Value
Terra Schnupperspiel
item.comment: Might be the best demo out there.

item.name: Third and Long: The Football Card Game
Through the Ages: A New Story of Civilization
Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
item.comment:
This is my favourite game that I have no idea how to play and lose badly all the time :) The mechanics work here great, they create a complex but very interesting game. The big variety of technology cards give you the possibility to push your civilization in many different paths.You really have the feeling of building a civilization. It can be annoyingly random sometimes when you play more.
simple rules - I haven't played them but I don't believe I would like them. Too little time to do anything fun.
advance rules - good as an introduction for the first few games.
full game - the real beauty.

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization – Czech expansion
Through the Ages: Spanish Promo Card Set
Thurn and Taxis: All Roads Lead to Rome
Tic-Tac-Toe
item.comment:
"Games" that can be solved by a human mind are in my opinion broken. And I give a 1 to all games I consider to be broken.
But it does not mean I have any bad feelings towards this one. It is a great tool to introduce kids to games, to teach them logical thinking and it is a nice puzzle.

item.name: Tichu
item.comment: A great partnership card game. Probably the best one if you don't want to invest the time to learn Bridge well. Tichu is much more easy to start playing.

item.name: Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 1 – Team Asia & Legendary Asia
Ticket to Ride: The Card Game
Ticket to Ride: The Dice Expansion
Tiki Topple
item.comment: Random, almost no control, the decisions you make are not important.

item.name: To Court the King
item.comment: Rolling, rolling, rolling, rolling, rolling. The last turn is fun but the rest... The cards are too similar to each other - really it doesn't matter much if you get a 3 or 4 pips on a die, as you will probably re-roll it anyway. The result is that before the last turn most of the players have exactly the same chance of winning the game, and the last turn randomly decides who wins.

item.name: Trains
item.comment: A nice shot at making a "board" deckbuilding game. Unfortunately the cards seem to be a bit boring.

item.name: Treasure Chest
item.comment: The dragon one.

item.name: Tribal Dice
item.comment: I don't believe there is any depth here.

item.name: Troyes
item.comment:
The one thing that this game lacks is a part of the game in which low numbers work better than high ones. As it is you always want to roll as high as possible and if you have low dice rolls then you probably have no chance winning. The other problem is that when playing with people who tend to have P/A the game will probably be very long.
On the plus side the game feels very euro-ish, players have lots of decisions to make, many options to deal with their dice rolls and there is some negative interaction.

item.name: Tumblin-Dice
item.comment:
This is stupid. It's almost nothing but random, you really don't control on which side your dice will end and you barely can control the direction it will go. It's still fun to play but it is the worse flicking game I have played so far.
If you want a serious dexterity game get Carrom. If you want a party dexterity game get Crokinole.

item.name: Tuscany: Expand the World of Viticulture
Twilight Imperium (Third Edition): Shards of the Throne
Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calendar – Tribes & Prophecies
Völuspá
item.comment: I don't like tile placement and I didn't like this one.

item.name: War
item.comment: No decisions = not a game.

item.name: War on Terror
item.comment: Definitely not a 3 player game. With 5 or 6 it would probably be not so bad.

item.name: Watson & Holmes: From the Diaries of 221B
Werewolf
item.comment: 5->9 5 is for a game IRL 9 is for a forum game. 2 very different things.

item.name: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
Wings of War: Watch Your Back!
Witch!
item.comment: Pure luck = not a game.

item.name: The Witcher: The Adventure Card Game
Wok Star: Paige Turner Promo Character
World of Warcraft Trading Card Game
Yavalath
item.comment: I'm surprised how much I liked this one. The 4 in a row wins 3 in a row loses forces you to think different than in other similar games. One of the best n in a row out there.

item.name: Yucata'
item.comment: Games "the first player always loses" are stupid.
